result.execSummary:
The defendant Lanie L Rodewald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lanie L Rodewald in court without counsel. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - there was a DA Pretrial, agreement to Ct 1 - 6 months probation, DV programming, follow recommendations of agent, court costs of $463 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge
Court - speaks to the deft's right to counsel
Deft - waives right to attorney, agrees that is the plea agreement
Court - reads charges and max penalties

Deft - enters a no contest plea to Ct 1, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts plea to Ct 1 and finds defendant guilty 

State - asks Court to accept joint agreement, 1 day jail credit if revoked
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court - sentence withheld, 6 months probation
  - Complete domestic violence programming
  - Follow recommendations of agent
  - Credit for 1 day if revoked
  - Pay courts costs of $443 + $20 crime prevention surcharge + $100 domestic violence programming
